wikipedia_page.main: Doctor Haydock "Doc" Greenwood (31 October 1860 – 3 November 1951) was an English footballer who played for Blackburn Rovers and made two appearances for England in 1882. "Doctor" was his Christian name and was not in recognition of any medical or academic qualifications.

response: * Doctor Greenwood (1860–1951), Blackburn Rovers and England international footballer

The 13–0 routing of Ireland on 18 February 1882, when Bambridge was captain, is England's highest ever winning margin. In this match, three Old Malvernians were present, including Bambridge; the others being Doctor Greenwood and Fred Hargreaves.
* Doctor Greenwood (1860–1951), Blackburn Rovers and England international footballerBetts, Graham (2006) p.114
